Package mmj.lang

Class LogicalSystem

java.lang.Object
mmj.lang.LogicalSystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
SystemLoader
public class LogicalSystem extends Object implements SystemLoader
The LogicalSystem, along with the rest of the mmj.lang package, implements the abstract portion of the Metamath language -- the "object" language of Metamath, as opposed to the "metalanguage" of Metamath source files. For example, note that LogicalSystem.java does not care which characters are used in Constant, Variable and Label strings. The characters are represented internally in Unicode, not the 7-bit ASCII employed in Metamath (.mm) source files. Nevertheless, the logical rules concerning Constant, Variable and Label namespaces are enforced rigorously :) As much as possible, the concerns of source files are delegated to the mmj.mmio package and its highest level class, Systemizer.java, which uses LogicalSystem.java to create a Metamath logical system in memory. Once Systemizer.java has input a set of Metamath statements into a LogicalSystem.java object, the Logical System can be processed independently of all mmj.mmio code. In fact, a GUI system need not use mmj.mmio or Systemizer.java at all (however it should be noted that none of this code is "thread aware" as of now...)
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • LogicalSystem

      public LogicalSystem(String provableLogicStmtTypeParm, String logicStmtTypeParm, GMFFManager gmffManager, BookManager bookManager, SeqAssigner seqAssigner, int symTblInitialSize, int stmtTblInitialSize, ProofVerifier proofVerifier, SyntaxVerifier syntaxVerifier)
      Construct with full set of parameters.
      Parameters:
      provableLogicStmtTypeParm - Type Code String of provable statements. Defaults to "|-".
      logicStmtTypeParm - Type Code String value of logic expressions. Defaults to "wff".
      gmffManager - used for Graphics Mode Formula Formatting in Proof Assistant but loaded with $t typesetting info by Systemizer.
      bookManager - optional, used for tracking MObjs by Chapter and Section number.
      seqAssigner - used to generate sequence numbers for MObjs
      symTblInitialSize - should equal number of constant and variables, times 1.33 plus a fudge factor. If set too small the system will automatically increase, but at the expense of reallocating and copying. BUT, if the input value is less than 10, the program assumes a programming error exists and throws an IllegalArgumentException. A suggested default value is provided in LangConstants.java.
      stmtTblInitialSize - should equal number of variable and logical hypotheses plus the number of axioms and theorems, times 1.33 plus a fudge factor. If set too small the system will automatically increase, but at the expense of reallocating and copying. BUT, if the input value is less than 100, the program assumes a programming error exists and throws an IllegalArgumentException. A suggested default value is provided in LangConstants.java.
      proofVerifier - ProofVerifier interface object. Leave null if automatic proof verification not desired.
      syntaxVerifier - SyntaxVerifier interface object. Leave null if automatic loading of ExprRPN's is not desired.

  • Method Details

    • addCnst

      public Cnst addCnst(String id) throws LangException
      Add Cnst to Logical System.

      1) validates constant:

      • declaration allowed only at global scope level
      • not a dup of any other constant or variable

      2)adds to symTbl table

      3)return the constant object that now exists in the symbol table (this is done for consistency with the other addXXX methods -- we want everyone to use the only objects that exist in LogicalSystem... otherwise, CHAOS would occur!

      Specified by:
      addCnst in interface SystemLoader
      Parameters:
      id - Constant's symbol string to be added to the Logical System.
      Returns:
      Cnst added to LogicalSystem.
      Throws:
      LangException - if duplicate symbol, etc.

    • addVar

      public Var addVar(String id) throws LangException
      Add Var to Logical System.

      1) validates variable:

      • must not be redeclared unless currently inactive
      • not a dup of any other constant or variable

      2) add to symTbl table; if already there but inactive, mark it active.

      3) get current ScopeDef array list item, (if any) and add the new var to the scope array list of Var's.

      4) return the variable object that now exists in the symbol table (a key step so that everyone is using the same object!!!)

      Specified by:
      addVar in interface SystemLoader
      Parameters:
      id - Var's symbol string to be added to the Logical System.
      Returns:
      Var added to LogicalSystem.
      Throws:
      LangException - if duplicate symbol, etc.

    • addVarHyp

      public VarHyp addVarHyp(String labelS, String typS, String varS) throws LangException
      Add VarHyp to Logical System.

      1)Validates VarHyp label:

        --must not already exist (label must be unique.)

      2)Validates VarHyp typ and var:

        --must exist in symTbl as active Cnst and Var, respectively. --marks the var as "active" and the typ as a variable type.

      3)Manufacture an active VarHyp, complete with sequence number

      4)Add the new variable hypothesis to the statement table.

      5) get current ScopeDef array list item, (if any) and add the new VarHyp to the scope array list of VarHyp's

      6) return the VarHyp object that now exists in the statement table.

      Specified by:
      addVarHyp in interface SystemLoader
      Parameters:
      labelS - String label of variable hypothesis
      typS - String Metamath constant character (type code)
      varS - String Metamath variable character
      Returns:
      VarHyp added to LogicalSystem.
      Throws:
      LangException - if duplicate symbol, etc. (see mmj.lang.LangConstants.java)

    • addDjVars

      public DjVars addDjVars(String djVar1S, String djVar2S) throws LangException
      Add DjVars (Disjoint Variables Restriction) to Logical System.

      1) validates disjoint variables:

      • must be active in scope
      • not duplicates of each other

      2) construct DjVars element (swapping the items if necessary to ensure varLo < varHi.--see constructor).

      3) get current ScopeDef array list item

      4) add the DjVars elment to the scope list of DjVars, but only if the pair of variables is not already there (we cannot use "==" in this case because DjVars are not maintained as "unique" in the same way as Sym's and Stmt's.)

      Specified by:
      addDjVars in interface SystemLoader
      Parameters:
      djVar1S - disjoint variable symbol string 1
      djVar2S - disjoint variable symbol string 2
      Returns:
      DjVars (pair) added to LogicalSystem.within the current scope, *or* the existing DjVars object in the current scope.
      Throws:
      LangException - if duplicate vars, etc. (see mmj.lang.LangConstants.java)

    • addLogHyp

      public LogHyp addLogHyp(String labelS, String typS, List<String> symList) throws LangException
      Add LogHyp (Logical Hypothesis) to Logical System.

      Basically a clone of addAxiom below, except that:

      • there is no Frame for a logical hypothesis
      • LogHyp is a Hyp, not an Assrt and has attribute "VarHyp[] varHypArray.

      Required processing:

      1) validates input label, type and expression symbols, and in the process obtaining references to their existing definitions in LogicalSystem:

      • must be active in scope
      • not be a duplicate
      • active VarHyp must exist for each Var.

      2) construct the LogHyp object

      3) add it to the stmtTbl and to the existing scope.

      4) return it to the caller

      Specified by:
      addLogHyp in interface SystemLoader
      Parameters:
      labelS - logical hypothesis label string
      typS - logical hypothesis type code (symbol) string
      symList - list containing expression symbol strings (zero or more symbols).
      Returns:
      LogHyp newly constructed LogHyp added to LogicalSystem.
      Throws:
      LangException - if duplicate label, undefined vars, etc.

    • addLogHypForTheoremLoader

      public LogHyp addLogHypForTheoremLoader(int seq, String labelS, String typS, List<String> symList) throws LangException
      Add LogHyp (Logical Hypothesis) to Logical System. for TheoremLoader.

      The main difference from the regular addLogHyp is that the BookManager is not called.

      Parameters:
      seq - preassigned MObj seq number
      labelS - logical hypothesis label string
      typS - logical hypothesis type code (symbol) string
      symList - list containing expression symbol strings (zero or more symbols).
      Returns:
      LogHyp newly constructed LogHyp added to LogicalSystem.
      Throws:
      LangException - if duplicate label, undefined vars, etc.

    • addAxiom

      public Axiom addAxiom(String labelS, String typS, List<String> symList) throws LangException
      Add Axiom to Logical System.

      1) validates input label, type and expression symbols, and in the process obtaining references to their existing definitions in LogicalSystem:

      • not a duplicate
      • active VarHyp must exist for each Var.

      2) Build the MetaMath "Frame" for the Axiom (see ScopeFrame)

      3) construct the Axiom object

      4) add it to the stmtTbl

      5) return it to the caller

      Specified by:
      addAxiom in interface SystemLoader
      Parameters:
      labelS - axiom label string
      typS - axiom type code (symbol) string
      symList - list containing axiom expression symbol strings (zero or more symbols).
      Returns:
      Axiom newly constructed Axiom added to LogicalSystem.
      Throws:
      LangException - if duplicate label, undefined vars, etc.

    • addTheorem

      public Theorem addTheorem(String labelS, int column, String typS, List<String> symList, List<String> proofList, Messages messages) throws LangException
      Add Theorem to Logical System.

      addTheorem is basically a clone of addAxiom except that it builds an "extended" Frame containing "optional" hypotheses and disjoint variable restriction information. And it validates the input proof list then stores it with the new Theorem object.

      1) validates input label, type and expression symbols, and in the process obtaining references to their existing definitions in LogicalSystem:

      • must be active in scope
      • not a duplicate
      • active VarHyp must exist for each Var.

      2) Build the MetaMath Extended Frame for the Theorem (consists here in mmj of MandFrame + OptFrame).

      3) Validates proof steps

      4) Construct Theorem object

      5) add it to the stmtTbl

      6) return it to the caller

      Specified by:
      addTheorem in interface SystemLoader
      Parameters:
      labelS - axiom label string
      column - the column at which the "$p" line starts
      typS - axiom type code (symbol) string
      symList - list containing axiom expression symbol strings (zero or more symbols).
      proofList - list containing proof step symbol strings (1 or more symbols -- which may be "?" if a step is unknown).
      messages - for error reporting
      Returns:
      Theorem newly constructed Theorem added to LogicalSystem.
      Throws:
      LangException - if duplicate label, undefined vars, etc.

    • addTheoremForTheoremLoader

      public Theorem addTheoremForTheoremLoader(int seq, String labelS, String typS, List<String> symList, List<String> proofList) throws LangException
      Add Theorem to Logical System for TheoremLoader.

      Main difference of regular addTheorem is that it does not call BookManager.

      Parameters:
      seq - preassigned MObj seq number
      labelS - axiom label string
      typS - axiom type code (symbol) string
      symList - list containing axiom expression symbol strings (zero or more symbols).
      proofList - list containing proof step symbol strings (1 or more symbols -- which may be "?" if a step is unknown).
      Returns:
      Theorem newly constructed Theorem added to LogicalSystem.
      Throws:
      LangException - if duplicate label, undefined vars, etc.

    • addTheorem

      public Theorem addTheorem(String labelS, int column, String typS, List<String> symList, List<String> proofList, BlockList proofBlockList, Messages messages) throws LangException
      Add Theorem to Logical System.

      addTheorem is basically a clone of addAxiom except that it builds an "extended" Frame containing "optional" hypotheses and disjoint variable restriction information. And it validates the input proof list then stores it with the new Theorem object.

      This variant is invoked when the input contains a compressed proof.

      Specified by:
      addTheorem in interface SystemLoader
      Parameters:
      labelS - axiom label string
      column - the column at which the "$p" line starts
      typS - axiom type code (symbol) string
      symList - list containing axiom expression symbol strings (zero or more symbols).
      proofList - list containing the contents of the parenthesized portion of a compressed proof (does not include the parentheses)
      proofBlockList - list containing one or more blocks of compressed proof symbols.
      messages - for error reporting
      Returns:
      Theorem newly constructed Theorem added to LogicalSystem.
      Throws:
      LangException - if duplicate label, undefined vars, etc.

    • beginScope

      public void beginScope()
      Begin a new (nested) scope level for the Logical System.

      Adds a new ScopeDef item to the "stack" and increments the level number by 1 (all of the hard work is in endScope()!)

      Note: *global* scope has level number = 0.

      Specified by:
      beginScope in interface SystemLoader
      See Also:
      • ScopeDef

    • endScope

      public void endScope() throws LangException
      Ends a (nested) scope level for the Logical System.

      Processing:

      1) if scope level = 0 (global), raise LangException.

      otherwise,

      2)

      1. go through items in ScopeDef for the current level (Var, VarHyp, and LogVar) and mark them inactive (not forgetting the Var attribute "activeVarHyp" when deactivating the corresponding VarHyp.)
      2. remove the scope level from the stack
      3. decrement current scope level number
      Specified by:
      endScope in interface SystemLoader
      Throws:
      LangException - if scope is already at the global scope level.
      See Also:
      • ScopeDef

    • finalizeEOF

      public void finalizeEOF(Messages messages, boolean prematureEOF) throws LangException
      EOF processing for Logical System after file loaded.

      Called at end of file to verify that there was an End Scope statement for each Begin Scope. At the time this routine is called, the ScopeDef list should contain just one entry, the "global" scope level (which is, by definition, level 0.)

      Specified by:
      finalizeEOF in interface SystemLoader
      Parameters:
      messages - Messages object to error reporting.
      prematureEOF - signals LoadLimit requested by user has been reached, so stop loading even if in the middle of a scope level.
      Throws:
      LangException - if scope is NOT at the global scope level UNLESS premature EOF signalled. (see mmj.lang.LangConstants.java)

    • verifyAllSyntax

      public void verifyAllSyntax(Messages messages) throws VerifyException
      Does Syntactical Analysis of the grammar and all statements in the LogicalSystem.
      Parameters:
      messages - Messages object for reporting errors.
      Throws:
      VerifyException - if an error occurred

    • verifyProofs

      public void verifyProofs(Messages messages) throws VerifyException
      Verifies every theorem's proof according to Metamath.pdf specifications.
      Parameters:
      messages - Messages object for reporting errors.
      Throws:
      VerifyException - if an error occurred

    • verifyAllExprRPNAsProofs

      public void verifyAllExprRPNAsProofs(Messages messages) throws VerifyException
      Double-checks the results of verifyAllSyntax by feeding the output exprRPN's through the ProofVerifier.

      Based on the fact that the output of the grammatical parser is a *proof* that a statement's formula can be generated using the grammatical parse tree -- which is stored in LogicalSystem in Reverse Polish Notation, like proofs.

      Should not be necessary in normal use, but is very helpful for testing.

      Parameters:
      messages - Messages object for reporting errors.
      Throws:
      VerifyException - if an error occurred

    • getScopeDefList

      public List<ScopeDef> getScopeDefList()
      Get LogicalSystem scopeDefList

      scopeDefList is an List of ScopeDef objects where element 0 is global scope, element 1 is scope level 1, etc. At the end of LoadFile the scopeDefList should contain only 1 element -- the global ScopeDef.

      Returns:
      List of ScopeDef objects.

      Returns:

    • getScopeLvl

      public int getScopeLvl()
      Get current scope level.

      Level 0 is global scope, 1 is level 1, etc.

      Returns:
      current scope level.

    • cacheTypesettingCommentForGMFF

      public void cacheTypesettingCommentForGMFF(String comment)
      Cache Metamath comment containing typesetting definitions for use by GMFF.

      Note: comment is from mmj.mmio.SrcStmt so it does not contain the "$(" and "$)" start/end comment id tokens which are standard to Metamath comments.

      Note: per agreement with Norm, the "$t" token identifying typesetting definitions in a comment is the first non-whitespace token after the "$(" in the comment.

      Specified by:
      cacheTypesettingCommentForGMFF in interface SystemLoader
      Parameters:
      comment - Typesetting definition comment ("$t) from Metamath file minus the "$(" and "$)" tokens.

    • theoremLoaderRollback

      public void theoremLoaderRollback(MMTTheoremSet mmtTheoremSet, MMJException error, Messages messages, boolean auditMessages) throws TheoremLoaderException
      Reverses any changes made to the mmj2 state by TheoremLoader for a mmtTheoremSet set of updates.

      Reverses any changes to the LogicalSystem scopeDefList.

      Rollsback any changes to the SeqAssigner.

      Scans the mmtTheoremSet and un-does each TheoremStmtGroup object's updates, if any,

      Parameters:
      mmtTheoremSet - set of MMTTheoremStmtGroups which may or may not have already been updated into mmj2.
      error - an explanatory message about the cause of the rollback to be inserted into a final message if the rollback itself fails.
      messages - Messages object.
      auditMessages - flag indicating whether or not audit messages about the rollback are to be written to the Messages object.
      Throws:
      TheoremLoaderException - with the rollback info

    • theoremLoaderCommit

      public void theoremLoaderCommit(MMTTheoremSet mmtTheoremSet)
      Finalizes any changes made to the mmj2 state by TheoremLoader for a mmtTheoremSet set of updates.

      Commits SeqAssigner updates.

      Commits BookManager updates.

      Sends commit() request to every TheoremLoaderCommitListener.

      Parameters:
      mmtTheoremSet - set of MMTTheoremStmtGroups which may or may not have already been updated into mmj2.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the commit operation fails.
